attributes.action: Stop members of the Scottish Parliament voting in the House of Commons
attributes.background: MSP's salaries are paid by the Scottish Government, they are elected in Scotland and represent their constituents in Scotland, so why should they be able to vote in our Parliament.

rejection.details:
Members of the Scottish Parliament are not able to vote in the House of Commons unless they are also Members of the UK Parliament. 

You may wish to submit a petition asking for the law to be changed so that MSPs are prohibited from also holding a seat in the House of Commons.
